trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of Vitamin D Supplementation on Cardiovascular and Respiratory Disease Event Rates, and the incidence of fractures
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of Vitamin D Supplementation on Cardiovascular and Respiratory Disease Event Rates in Older Adults, and the incidence of non-vertebral fractures.

interventions.interventions: Vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol) 200,000 IU oral capsule at baseline, then 100,000 IU oral capsule monthly for 4 years

primaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence rate of fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular disease, as assessed by mortality, hospital discharges and family doctors.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 4 years and 6 months after randomisation of first participant.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence rate of respiratory disease, as assessed by mortality, hospital discharges and consultations with family doctors.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 4 years and 6 months after randomisation of first participant.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence rate of non-vertebral fractures, as assessed by hospital discharges, consultations with family doctors and self-reported questionnaires.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 4 years and 6 months after randomisation of first participant.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Time to first cancer for all neoplasms: ICD-10 codes: C00-D09 (excluding non-melanoma skin cancer) reported after randomization to the NZ Cancer Registry
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From randomization to stopping the study medication (31 July 2015)

trial_design.concealment:
Participants will be recruited from patient registers of general practitioners in Auckland.
Once eligibility is confirmed, randomisation to either arm of the study will be done by computer.
trial_design.sequence: Randomisation with variable block size within 5 year age and ethnic strata.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The main aims of the study are to see if vitamin D supplementation reduces the incidence rates of cardiovascular disease, respiratory disease and non-vertebral fractures.
